sentences.en: ...a tiny fossil plant, only a few centimetres high.
sentences.cn: …一块小小的植物化石，只有几厘米高。

sentences.en: Almost silently she pushed herself forwards centimetre by centimetre in her black, skin - tight, custom made outfit.
sentences.cn: 几乎默默耕耘,她把自己前锋厘米,由厘米在她的黑色, 皮肤紧绌, 定制服装.

sentences.en: He's one hundred and 50 centimetre tall.
How many imperial inches are there in one metric centimetre? — Naught point three nine three seven inches.
sentences.cn: 一厘米等于多少英寸? ——等于0.397英寸.

sentences.en: It was impossible to move so much as a centimetre in any direction.
sentences.cn: 但是不论朝什么方向,他连一毫米都动弹不得.

sentences.en: Jupiter'smoon Io, whose density is 3.5 grams per cubic centimetre, is all rock.
sentences.cn: 密度为每立方厘米3.5克的木星卫星木卫一上遍布岩石。

sentences.en: One centimetre is equal to 10 millimetres.
Round each measurement to the nearest whole inch or centimetre.
sentences.cn: 将每个测量数目四舍五入到最近的英寸或厘米整数.

sentences.en: Surf lifesavers removed the 60 centimetre shark by hosing it with fresh water.
sentences.cn: 最后救生员用淡水围着60公分的鲨鱼洒水,才得己松口.

sentences.en: The length is measured in meter, kilometre, and centimetre.
sentences.cn: 长度是以米 、 公里 、 厘米为来计算的.

sentences.en: The snails are no larger than one centimetre across.
sentences.cn: 这些蜗牛体宽不超过1厘米。

sentences.en: The volume of this container be 24 cubic centimetre.
sentences.cn: 这容器的体积是24立方厘米.

sentences.en: This ruler have one scale in centimetre and another in inch.
sentences.cn: 这把尺上有厘米的刻度和英寸的刻度.

sentences.en: We moved slowly across the moor, looking at every centimetre of mud.
sentences.cn: 我们慢慢的穿过沼泽, 观察着每一公分的泥泞.

trans.tran_en: a unit for measuring length. There are 100 centimetres in one metre.
